revision.comment: Robot - Speedily moving category Dassault aircraft to [[:Category:Dassault Group aircraft]] per [[WP:CFDS|CFDS]].
revision.text:
The '''Dassault LOGIDUC''' -sometimes spelled '''Logiduc''' in French and '''LogiDuc''' in English- ('''''Logi'''que de '''D'''éveloppement d''''UC'''AV'', French for "Unmanned Combat Aerial Vehicle development solution") was an autonomous industrial program launched in 1999 by the French aircraft manufacturer [[Dassault Aviation]] in view to develop its [[Unmanned aerial vehicle|UAV]] design capacities. This French programme eventually led to the creation of the [[Dassault-Sagem Tactical UAV]] company and to the European "combat drone" project [[nEUROn]].
The LOGIDUC program consisted of a series of three stealth aerial vehicles, from scale 1/100 to 1/1, in view to collect data required by the production of a fighter-sized stealth UCLAV type supporting the [[Dassault Rafale]] in the 2010s and to design autonomous stealth fighters primary used by the French Air Force circa 2025.
The two first vehicles, [[Dassault AVE-D Petit Duc|AVE-D]] and [[Dassault AVE-C Moyen Duc|AVE-C]], are scale model 1/100 (50kg) and 1/10 (500kg) stealth "tactical drones" (UAV), while the [[Dassault AVE Grand Duc|final version]] was to be a full-scale (5,000kg) prototype stealth "combat drone" (UCAV).
Each vehicle was given an owl name as "Duc" ("duke") is the French name of a nocturnal [[bird of prey]] species known in [[Latin]] as ''Otus'' aka [[Scops owl]]. ''Petit Duc'' ("small duke") stands for [[European scops owl|scops owl]], ''Moyen Duc'' ("medium duke") stands for [[long-eared owl]] and ''Grand Duc'' ("large duke") is [[Eurasian eagle owl|eagle owl]]. Other Dassault aircraft with bird names are the [[Dassault MD 315 Flamant]] ([[flamingo]]), the [[Dassault Falcon]] ([[falcon]]) family and the [[Dassault Hirondelle]] ([[swallow]]).
LOGIDUC was a 3-step program with the following aims: <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Petitduc-landing-ave-d-dassault-2000.png|thumb|right|200px|A.V.E, the first stealth unmanned aircraft to fly in Europe.]] --> *'''[[Dassault AVE-D Petit Duc|Petit Duc]]''': :Mastering stealth aircraft design. :Confronting stealth aircraft to modern air-to-air combat systems. :Confronting stealth aircraft to modern ground-to-air combat systems. *'''[[Dassault AVE-C Moyen Duc|Moyen Duc]]''': :Experimenting unstable yaw aircraft control methods. *'''Grand Duc''': :Acquiring full mission system representativity. :Acquiring composite pack airborne control. :Acquiring collaborative flight with drones and aircraft. :Acquiring live air-to-ground weapon release.
The Petit Duc and Moyen Duc both reached the flying stage; the Grand Duc was cancelled in 2003 and replaced by the [[Dassault nEUROn|nEUROn]] European project.
==See also== *[[Dassault nEUROn]] *[[Dassault-Sagem SlowFast]]
==References== {{No footnotes|date=May 2009}} {{reflist}} * [http://www.dassault-aviation.com/defense/uav/ Dassault UAV] (Dassault's official website) * [http://www.senat.fr/rap/r05-215/r05-2158.html Report excerpt: The nEUROn project, launched by France, is joined by its main European partners (Senators Maryse Bergé-Lavigne & Philippe Nogrix, Feb.22 2006)] (French Senate's official website) * [http://www.senat.fr/rap/r05-215/r05-2151.pdf Full report: Drones role in the armies (Senators Maryse Bergé-Lavigne & Philippe Nogrix, Feb.22 2006)] (French Senate's official website)] * [http://www.adjets.com/ AVE-D Petit Duc prototype manufacturer] (Aviation Design's official website) * [http://www.european-security.org/index.php?id=4674 Dassault's Logiduc programme] (European-Security's official website) * [http://www.defense.gouv.fr/portal_repository/113830641__0003/fichier/getData The European technology demonstrator nEUROn, February 9, 2006, French Defence Ministry] * [http://www.safran-group.com/article.php3?id_article=193&var_recherche=UAV Dassault-Sagem tactical UAV company creation]
==Media links== * <small>video</small>: [http://perso.orange.fr/aviationdesign/uav/video/ave_tv.avi AVE-D Petit Duc test flight, 2000] (Aviation Design/Dassault Aviation) * <small>video</small>: [http://www.dassault-aviation.com/gb/technologie/HigherTechnology-va-vod.zip AVE-C Moyen Duc flight (also AVE-D Petit Duc escorting a Rafale), January 2004] (Pascal Fellous/Dassault Aviation) * <small>video</small>: [http://www.dassault-aviation.com/groupe/activites/DASSAULT_ACTIVITIES_vod.zip AVE-C, AVE-D & nEUROn design and flight, Dassault Activities] (Dassault Aviation) * <small>video</small>: [http://62.210.175.228/tvdassault2003/kiosque/simple.php?action=detail&videoid=222&mediaid=2040&media=WinMedia&debit=haut&lien=wms0611111207hd0.wvx nEUROn (AVE Grand Duc vers.) promotional featurette, June 11, 2005] (Dassault Aviation)
